wrappers.name: cf console
wrappers.description: Connect into an app container using the CF CLI.

wrappers.name: cf open
wrappers.description: Easily open Cloud Foundry apps & service dashboards in browser.

wrappers.name: cf zero-downtime-push
wrappers.description: CF plugin for hands-off, zero downtime application deploys.

wrappers.name: cf live-stats
wrappers.description: This plug-in allows you to view live usage stats for an application in a browser.

wrappers.name: cf org-space
wrappers.description: Org-Space will automatically detect whether the organisation and space exist, if not it will create them, and finally target them.

wrappers.name: cf seed
wrappers.description: Seed creates orgs, spaces, and pushes applications to a new Cloud Foundry.

wrappers.name: CF Playground
wrappers.description: The goal of this project is to provide an easily accessible environment for users who want to experience Cloud Foundry, without having to setup and to learn the operation of the platform. CF Playground provides an interactive tutorial.

wrappers.name: etherpad-lite
wrappers.description: This repo contains a modified version of the original etherpad-lite modified to natively run on cloudfoundry, possibly on an offline mode.

wrappers.name: ws-collector
wrappers.description: Simple websocket bridge with configurable MQ back-end. Supports Apache Kafka, RabbitMQ, MQTT.

wrappers.name: spring-music demo app
wrappers.description: A sample application for using database services on Cloud Foundry with Spring Framework.

wrappers.name: show cf environment
wrappers.description: Demo web app that displays Cloud Foundry environment variables

wrappers.name: cf-pancake
wrappers.description: Flatten $VCAP_SERVICES into regular environment variables.

wrappers.name: Java component library
wrappers.description: A set of libraries for building Cloud Foundry components on the Java platform.

wrappers.name: Java NATS library
wrappers.description: A Java client for the excellent NATS lightweight publish-subscribe and distributed queueing messaging system used by Cloud Foundry.

wrappers.name: go-cfenv
wrappers.description: cfenv is a package to assist you in writing Go apps that run on Cloud Foundry. It provides convenience functions and structures that map to Cloud Foundry environment variable primitives.

wrappers.name: node-cfenv
wrappers.description: cfenv is a package to assist you in writing Node.JS apps that run on Cloud Foundry. It provides convenience functions and structures that map to Cloud Foundry environment variable primitives.

wrappers.name: go-cfclient
wrappers.description: cfclient is a package to assist you in writing apps that need information out of Cloud Foundry. It provides functions and structures to retrieve data from Cloud Controller API.

wrappers.name: types-cf
wrappers.description: Common Cloud Foundry Go types compatible with the CF v2 API.

wrappers.name: cf-go-client-example
wrappers.description: Example Go application that is an OAuth UAA client.

wrappers.name: Staticfile buildpack
wrappers.description: Deploy static HTML/JS/CSS apps to Cloud Foundry.

wrappers.name: JBoss buildpack
wrappers.description: Cloud Foundry buildpack for running Java applications.

wrappers.name: traveling-bosh
wrappers.description: This project packages the BOSH CLI (with plugins), terraform and spiff into self-contained packages that can be downloaded and used by anyone without requiring Ruby and native extensions.

wrappers.name: traveling-cf-admin
wrappers.description: This project packages the CLIs used by Cloud Foundry administrators - the cf CLI and useful admin plugins, and the uaac CLI (a Ruby gem).

wrappers.name: terraform-aws-cf-install
wrappers.description: Simple, fast bootstrap of Cloud Foundry into new AWS VPC.

wrappers.name: terraform-aws-bosh
wrappers.description: This project will create an AWS VPC with subnets/route tables, a bastion VM (aka jumpbox/inception server), NAT (for outbound traffic), and a Micro BOSH.

wrappers.name: BOSH Workspace for Cloud Foundry
wrappers.description: This project's purpose is to help you easily deploy CloudFoundry in various configurations, small to large, in AWS.

wrappers.name: BOSH Workspace
wrappers.description: This is a bosh cli plugin for creating reproducible and upgradable deployments.

wrappers.name: bosh bootstrap
wrappers.description: From zero to a running micro BOSH in one command line.

wrappers.name: Consul monitoring of Cloud Foundry
wrappers.description: Monitor/advertise each job template from cf-release via consul.

wrappers.name: Jenkins BOSH release
wrappers.description: One of the fastest ways to get Jenkins running on any infrastructure is to deploy this bosh release.

wrappers.name: Logsearch BOSH workspace
wrappers.description: The fastest way to deploy Logsearch in combination with Cloud Foundry.

wrappers.name: Cloud Foundry/BOSH Jenkins Build System
wrappers.description: The purpose of this cookbook is to create a Jenkins build and test environment for Cloud Foundry and BOSH.

wrappers.name: Cloud Foundry Admin UI
wrappers.description: An application for viewing Cloud Foundry metrics and operations data.

wrappers.name: Cloud Foundry Admin UI BOSH Release
wrappers.description: One of the fastest ways to get Cloud Foundry Admin UI running on any infrastructure is too deploy this bosh release.

wrappers.name: Go Go BOSH
wrappers.description: Golang client library for applications wanting to talk to a BOSH/MicroBOSH or bosh-lite.

wrappers.name: Go Go BOSH for Cloud Foundry deployments
wrappers.description: The gogobosh golang package is a client library for a BOSH director. This gogoboshcf package enhances gogobosh for Cloud Foundry specific deployments.

wrappers.name: Choose your own infrastructure
wrappers.description: A library to ask an end-user to choose an infrastructure (AWS, OpenStack, etc), region, and login credentials.

wrappers.name: World's Simple Service Broker
wrappers.description: One service broker sharing the same binding credentials with everyone.

wrappers.name: bosh-gen
wrappers.description: Generators for creating and sharing BOSH releases to describe services.

wrappers.name: BOSH Workspace for Docker Service Broker
wrappers.description: The fastest way to deploy Docker Services in combination with Cloud Foundry.

wrappers.name: Service Broker using Docker - BOSH release
wrappers.description: Offer one of 16 different services via pre-configured Docker images.

wrappers.name: Service Broker using Docker containers
wrappers.description: A generic 'Containers' broker for the Cloud Foundry v2 services API.

wrappers.name: Docker BOSH release
wrappers.description: One of the fastest ways to get Docker and orchestrate containers with persistent data on any infrastructure is to deploy this BOSH release.

wrappers.name: Consul BOSH release
wrappers.description: BOSH release for consul.

wrappers.name: Redis BOSH release
wrappers.description: One of the fastest ways to get redis running on any infrastructure is too deploy this BOSH release.

wrappers.name: Redis/Consul BOSH release
wrappers.description: Advertise/monitor Redis clusters with Consul.

wrappers.name: Service Broker for Amazon S3
wrappers.description:
Service Broker for Amazon S3 built using the spring-boot-cf-service-broker.
The broker currently publishes a single service and plan for provisioning S3 buckets.

wrappers.name: BOSH CLI plugin for Consul
wrappers.description: If you're using consul within your BOSH deployments (such as redis-boshrelease), or running a cluster of consul servers (consul-boshrelease), this BOSH CLI plugin is a very handy ops tool.

wrappers.name: Service Gateway v1 for many services/databases
wrappers.description: This repository contains a 8 services that can be added into your own Cloud Foundry using the legacy v1 Services API.

wrappers.name: Community Advisory Board minutes
wrappers.description: Phil Whelan writes up a summary of every monthly CAB meeting

wrappers.name: Cloud Foundry Toolbox
wrappers.description: This site to share community contributions to Cloud Foundry

wrappers.name: BOSH Hub
wrappers.description: bosh.io site

wrappers.name: BOSH Hub - Repo
wrappers.description: bosh.io site source

wrappers.name: Shared Community BOSH releases
wrappers.description: See also https://bosh.io This project references BOSH release tarballs from across the BOSH community.

wrappers.name: Community Wiki
wrappers.description: This wiki is a scrapbook of information and links about Cloud Foundry, the open source Platform as a Service.
